context: The Estonian verb 'keppida' means to celebrate, party, or have a good time. It often refers to festive social gatherings with family and friends. This word is commonly used in the context of birthdays, holidays, or other special occasions where people come together to enjoy themselves. The verb can be conjugated in different forms like kepin (I celebrate), kepid (you celebrate), keppis (he/she/it celebrated), etc.
